intro: Xysmalobium pedifoetidum, commonly known as the stinking nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale green. Its leaves are simple and alternate, with a rough texture and a strong, unpleasant odor. The plant is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
